newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan buys 108,000T U.S. corn at tender.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan buys 108,000T U.S. corn at tender.

text.p: Taiwan's CK group on Wednesday bought two 54,000-tonne shipments of U.S. No.2 corn from Agrex and Kanematsu, traders said.
Traders said CK Group's purchase on Wednesday showed its buyers were worried that corn futures would move higher.
"CK Group must expect a bull market for corn futures, so they bought mostly on flat basis," a trader said.
The CK Group comprises Chia Hsin Flour Feed and Vegetable Oil Corp and some buyers from Taiwan's southern port city of Kaohsiung.
The first shipment was supplied by Kanematsu and was bought on a FOB basis and freight was fixed at US$14.50 per tonne from MIT, traders said.
The second shipment was provided by Argex and was bought on a cost-and-freight basis.
Traders have said Taiwan's MFIG corn-buying group planned to tender on Thursday for 54,000-56,000 tonnes U.S. or Argentine corn.
Details for the group's tender are as follows:
